criteria: Analysis of the Elements of America's Market Economy
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of basic economic principles such as supply and demand, scarcity, and opportunity cost.
Student demonstrates a minimal understanding of basic economic principles, with significant misconceptions.
Student demonstrates a partial understanding of basic economic principles but struggles to apply them in context.
Student demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of basic economic principles and can apply them to simple scenarios.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of basic economic principles and can apply them to complex scenarios.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of basic economic principles and can apply them to novel and complex global scenarios.
Student is unable to identify or analyze any elements of America's market economy.
Student identifies few elements of America's market economy, with no analysis.
Student identifies some elements of America's market economy but struggles to analyze their impact.
Student identifies and analyzes several elements of America's market economy, but with limited depth.
Student identifies and analyzes most elements of America's market economy with reasonable depth.
Student comprehensively identifies and analyzes all relevant elements of America's market economy with significant depth and insight.
Student shows no awareness of America's economic interdependence with the rest of the world.
Student demonstrates a minimal awareness of America's economic interdependence, with no specific examples.
Student identifies some ways in which America's economy is connected to the global economy but struggles to explain the relationships.
Student explains several ways in which America's economy is connected to the global economy.
Student thoroughly explains multiple aspects of America's economic connections with the global economy, providing specific examples.
Student demonstrates a sophisticated understanding of America's economic interdependence within the global setting, including nuanced relationships and potential impacts.
Student is unable to apply their knowledge to real-world scenarios.
Student attempts to apply their knowledge to real-world scenarios but demonstrates significant misunderstandings.
Student applies their knowledge to real-world scenarios with limited success and some inaccuracies.
Student applies their knowledge to real-world scenarios adequately.
Student effectively applies their knowledge to real-world scenarios, drawing reasonable conclusions.
Student insightfully applies their knowledge to complex, real-world scenarios, demonstrating a comprehensive understanding of potential outcomes.
